alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk; McKean; Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:49AM EST until January 14 at 8:45AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Cameron County in north central Pennsylvania... Elk County in north central Pennsylvania... Eastern McKean County in north central Pennsylvania... Western Potter County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 845 AM EST. * At 749 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Shinglehouse to Coryville to Wilcox to 10 miles south of Marienville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from Mount Jewett to east of Coudersport. Route 219 from Brandy Camp to north of Wilcox. State Road 46 from Smethport to Farmers Valley. State Road 59 from west of Smethport to Smethport. State Road 120 from Ridgway to north of Driftwood. State Road 255 from south of St. Marys to Johnsonburg. State Road 446 from Farmers Valley to Larabee. Locations impacted include... St. Marys, Ridgway, Johnsonburg, Cameron, Wharton, Coudersport, Port Allegany, Emporium, Smethport, Roulette, Shinglehouse, and Genesee. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
